aima.core.nlp.parsing

Class Lexicon

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<LexWord>>
        • aima.core.nlp.parsing.Lexicon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<LexWord>>

    public class Lexicon
extends java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<LexWord>>
    The Lexicon Object appears on pg. 891 of the text and defines a simple set of words for a certain language category and their associated probabilities. Defining and using a lexicon saves us from listing out a large number of rules to derive terminal strings in a grammar.
    Author:
    Jonathon
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
